task.title: Grip Stretch Mode
task.shortdesc: Stretch mode is the default mode for grip editing. Once you have selected entities, click the grips on entities to display command line prompt as follows:

context.p: Specify the stretch point or [Base point/Copy/Undo/eXit]:

Under the prompt, you can specify a new position in the drawing area where the grip is expected to be stretched. You should notice that when stretching grips on the selected grips such as single text point, insertion point of block reference, the midpoint of a line, the center of circle and grips on point object, the whole entity will be moved without changing the size and shape of grips. The type of entities determines whether the grips are capable of being stretched. For example, to stretch a corner of a rectangle, select the corner grips, to stretch a line, select the endpoint grips. Not all of the objects are enabled grip stretching.

step.cmd: Clickon grips of the entity to highlight the selected gripandactivate the grip mode as Stretch.
Dynamic input box displayed on screen showing the following manipulations:

info.p: Specify "B(Base point)" option to locate the grip.
Specify "C(Copy)" option to create a copy of the entity being stretched. Specify "U(Undo)" option to abort thelast stretch.
Specify "X(eXit)" option to exit stretch manipulation.
Specify target location for stretching directly.

step.info: Move the pointing device to specify target location, the selected grip on entities will be stretched based on itself (or the new base point).

result.p: To stretch an object using grips, select the object (A), select a grip (B), and drag the grip to its new location (C).
